title: Join the ENCATC Academy on Sustainable Cultural Management and Policy!
content:
We are pleased to be partners of the European network on cultural management and policy’s s 2026 Academy on Sustainable Cultural Management and Policy from 21-24 April 2026! Hosted by the Department of Culture of the Town Hall of Bilbao and the Department of Culture and Language Policy of the Basque Government, in partnership NEMO, Eurocities and Julie’s Bicycle! 

Registration and details: https://encatc.org/en/events/encatc-academy/home/

The ENCATC Academy is designed as a dynamic, action-oriented programme that empowers cultural pr
creator: Michael Culture
sourceDescription: EUROPEAN TRANS-DOMAIN NETWORK FOR DIGITAL CULTURAL HERITAGE AND RELATED COMMUNITIES

title: Building Bridges with Ambronay
content:
On 10 February 2026, Maria Teresa Natale and Pier Giacomo Sola presented our missions and main projects in a webinar organised by the CCR d’Ambronay (Cultural Centre of Ambronay, France).

The event was organised as part of a mobility project currently run by the CCR within the Erasmus+ programme and focused on analysing how local communities can anticipate transformations in cultural and tourism activities related to the development of digital tools.

Our contribution and experience focuses on three main elements:

  • A presentation of the Michael Culture Association, our role as a cross-sectoral European network and our various member communities.
  • An overview of MCA’s current practices in exploiting
creator: Michael Culture
sourceDescription: EUROPEAN TRANS-DOMAIN NETWORK FOR DIGITAL CULTURAL HERITAGE AND RELATED COMMUNITIES
